overview:
Erik Aeyelts Averink has been a non-executive board member at Qelp since 2009. He acts as a sounding board for the executive team on all aspects of growing Qelp. In addition to his role at Qelp, Erik holds non-executive board member positions at ADAM Software and Arco Information, is a venture partner at Newion Investments, and a trusted advisor to a number of software companies. Prior to his current roles, he was President at (SDL) Tridion, a company that provides web content management software where he was responsible for corporate and product strategy and played a significant role in helping Tridion to become a global leader. Tridion was acquired in 2007 by SDL. Prior to Tridion, Erik was a general partner at Gilde IT Fund, a venture firm responsible for more than 15 investments over a period of 11 years.

He is frequent lecturer on entrepreneurship, strategy for early stage companies and venture capital. Erik holds a masters degree in economics from Erasmus University in Rotterdam, The Netherlands.
